Comment 5: 
cmd/gc has a generic inliner which improves performance significantly.
so i think simply making cmd/6c use cmd/6g's backend won't fix all the
performance problems.
but adding a inliner to cmd/cc is probably not worth the trouble.

imo, major part (if not all) of the the runtime package could be rewritten
in Go (perhaps we need some compiler tweaks, but the runtime already
supplies a special -+ flag to cmd/gc).
